message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SD, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.SDQ 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with automatic speech recognition (ASR) quality estimation (QE) for system combination. It also involves the use of features and techniques for hypothesis ranking, which are common in natural language processing (NLP) tasks. 

It could also belong to cs.SD (Sound) as it deals with speech recognition and multiple-microphone recordings. 

cs.LG (Machine Learning) is another likely sub-category as the paper proposes a novel variant of Recognizer Output Voting Error Reduction (ROVER) that takes advantage of ASR quality estimation for ranking transcriptions at segment level. This involves the use of machine learning techniques for accurate hypothesis ranking. 

cs.SI (Signal Processing) is also a possible sub-category as the paper deals with multiple-microphone recordings and the management of tied ranks. 

Finally, cs.SDQ (Sound and Quality) is another possible sub-category as the paper deals with automatic quality estimation for ASR system combination.
